title: Learning From The Hateful Memes Challenge: Assessing the Generalizability of the Hateful Memes Challenge Dataset
description: We evaluate Facebook’s Hateful Memes Challenge using unimodal and mulitmodal models and assesses the deployment gap between synthetic memes and memes in the wild.

title: How True is GPT-2? An Empirical Analysis of Intersectional Occupational Biases
description: We prompt engineer GPT-2 with 7000 prefix templates and evaluate the biases in its predictions by comparing to ground-truth US labor data. We find that while GPT-2 encompasses many stereotypical biases, especially for intersectional categories, GPT-2 reflects the societal skew of gender and ethnicity in the US, and in some cases, pulls the distribution towards gender parity.

title: The Effect of Government Type on COVID-19 Restrictions
description: Were authoritarian governments more likely to enact more restrictive COVID-19 measures than democratic governments? I examine the relationship between government response to COVID-19 and country’s level of democracy and ask whether the regime type of a government has an impact on that government’s response.

title: Data Surveillance and Biocitizenship in the COVID-19 Pandemic: Digital Contact-tracing in South Korea, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Taiwan. in the COVID-19 Pandemic
description: This paper analyzes the privacy implications of digital contact tracing in East Asian countries during the COVID-19 pandemic through topic modeling and network analysis of news media. Analysis done across 6 countries and 3 languages.

title: Big Data as Historical Archive
description: This paper examines the future of born-digital archives and the implications of the Big Data paradigm and data centers to future historians.

title: Covid Texting Service
description: Texting service for answering questions related to the pandemic and providing COVID-19 statistics to those without access to Internet
Working with Silicon Harlem in NYC to get the service in the hands of people in need.

title: Joseon Munkwa Project
description: Named-Entity recognition and disambiguation on historical figures from Korean Joseon-Dynasty civil service roster data.

title: Virtual Coffeeshop
description: Virtual coffeeshop experience for those of us stuck at home during stay-at-home and seeking the vibe and comradeship of a cafe.

title: Music Factorization
description: Factorize a scale into parts that can be understood using combinations of 'symmetric' scales.
